workflows.description: Creates a new repository based on the repository type, repository name, and other input parameters that you have specified.
workflows.name: Create Repository

workflows.description: Deletes a repository including all associated resources, like issues and pull requests, based on the repository type, repository name, and other input parameters that you have specified.
workflows.name: Delete Repository

workflows.description: Retrieves information such as name, size, content, etc. about a file from the Bitbucket repository based on the repository ID, branch name, file name, and other input parameters that you have specified.
workflows.name: Get File Details

workflows.description: Creates or updates a single file in the Bitbucket repository based on the repository ID, branch name, file name and other input parameters.
workflows.name: Create or Update File Contents

routes.name: Start-> Create or Update File Contents

workflows.description: Updates(promote or demote) a user's permission levels for specified repository.
workflows.name: Update User Repository Permission

workflows.description: Retrieves a list of group or repository members viewable by the authenticated user, including inherited members, invited users, and permissions through ancestor groups.
workflows.name: Get Member List of Repository

routes.name: Start-> Get Member List of Repository

workflows.description: Lists repository branches for the specified repository on Bitbucket based on the repository type, organization or repository owner's name, repository name, and other input parameters you have specified
workflows.name: Get Repository Branch List

workflows.description: Creates a new branch in the repository based on the repository type, branch name, and other input parameters that you have specified.
workflows.name: Create Repository Branch

workflows.description: Deletes a branch from the repository based on the repository type and branch name that you have specified.
workflows.name: Delete Repository Branch

workflows.description: Lists pull requests for the specified repository on Bitbucket based on the repository type, organization or repository owner's name, repository name, and other input parameters you have specified
workflows.name: Get Pull Request List

workflows.description: Accept and merge changes in the pull request based on the repository type, repository name, and other input parameters that you have specified.
workflows.name: Merge Pull Request

workflows.description: Creates a pull request for the specified repository on Bitbucket based on the repository type, organization or repository owner's name, repository name, and other input parameters you have specified
workflows.name: Create Pull Request

workflows.description: Creates a new note/comment on a pull request based on the repository type, repository name, and other input parameters that you have specified.
workflows.name: Create Pull Request Comment

workflows.description: Retrieves a paginated list of tags, sorted by the date when they were released, based on the repository type, repository name, and other input parameters that you have specified.
workflows.name: Get Tag List

workflows.description: Creates a new Bitbucket tag based on the repository type, repository name, and other input parameters that you have specified. Developer level access to the repository is required to create a tag.
workflows.name: Create Tag

workflows.description: Retrieves the server URL (Web URL) of the configured Bitbucket server.
workflows.name: Get Server URL

workflows.description: Retrieves a list of all comments for a pull request based on the repository type, repository name, and other input parameters that you have specified.
workflows.name: Get Pull Request Comments

workflows.description: Clones the specified repository in a Bitbucket project based on the repository type, repository name, and other input parameters that you have specified.
workflows.name: Clone Repository

workflows.description: Applies changes made in a FortiSOAR file to the specified remote repository that is cloned from Bitbucket based on the file IRI and cloned repository path you have specified
workflows.name: Update Remote Repository

data.name: Sample - Bitbucket - 1.0.0
data.description: Bitbucket is a comprehensive platform designed to streamline the software development process. It encompasses all aspects of the development lifecycle, offering seamless integration and efficiency throughout the journey from initial project planning to deployment and beyond. With Bitbucket, teams can seamlessly manage their source code, facilitate collaboration, and ensure the quality and security of their software.
